tool_description: Converts laboratory test codes from various coding systems (LOINC, CPT, local codes) to a standardized format for consistent processing.

input_codes.description: Array of test codes to be standardized

source_coding_system.description: Source coding system: LOINC, CPT, ICD10, LOCAL

target_coding_system.description: Target coding system: LOINC, CPT, ICD10, SNOMED

mapping_version.description: Version of the code mapping table to use

fallback_handling.description: How to handle unmapped codes: PRESERVE, EXCLUDE, FLAG

error_messages: Invalid coding system: Use supported systems [LOINC, CPT, ICD10, LOCAL, SNOMED].
Empty code array: Provide at least one test code to standardize.
Mapping version not found: Verify the specified mapping version exists.
Code format error: Ensure input codes match the source coding system format.
usage: Provide an array of test codes, specify source and target coding systems. The tool returns standardized codes with mapping confidence scores.

standardized_codes.description: Array of codes converted to target coding system

unmapped_codes.description: Codes that could not be mapped to target system

conversion_summary.description: Summary of conversion process and results
